issue.title: is_callable is not a good name

discussion.p: is_callable is not a good name because it implies F(A...) instead of INVOKE(F, A...)
Proposed change: Rename is_callable to is_invocable and rename is_nothrow_callable to is_nothrow_invocable.
discussion.note: 2017-02-22, Daniel comments and provides concrete wording
discussion.p: I'm strongly in favour for this change to possibly allow for a future "pure" is_callable trait that solely describes function call-like expressions.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4640.

li.p: Modify , Table 44 — "Type relationship predicates", as indicated:

td.tt:
template <class Fn, class...
ArgTypes, class R>
struct is_invocablecallable<
Fn(ArgTypes...), R>;

template <class Fn, class...
ArgTypes, class R>
struct is_nothrow_invocablecallable<
Fn(ArgTypes...), R>;
